intro: Oreocarya disticha, commonly known as the two-branched mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Andes Mountains. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is adapted to cold, nutrient-poor soils. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with dense, compact foliage and produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white or pink. Its unique branching pattern and resilience to harsh alpine conditions make it a distinctive species in its habitat. Oreocarya disticha plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for alpine wildlife.
